H0.text: Terrestrial biomes are classified by climatic factors and types of primary producers.

H1.text: Equivalent biomes are classified by climatic factors and types of primary producers.

H2.text: Old biomes are classified by climatic factors and types of primary producers.

H3.text: Fossil biomes are classified by climatic factors and types of primary producers.

A4.text: Precipitation and water use lead to above-ground primary production, while solar irradiation and temperature lead to below-ground primary production.

A5.text: Holdridge classified climates based on the biological effects of temperature and rainfall on vegetation under the assumption that these two abiotic factors are the largest determinants of the types of vegetation found in a habitat.
